title: Force vs time graph for two carts

content.question: Identical blocks <math alttext="uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are being pulled by force sensors across a rough horizontal surface. The force <math alttext="F sub uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> exerted on block <math alttext="uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and the force <math alttext="F sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> exerted on block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as functions of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are shown on the graph. Which of the following could show the correct graphs for the accelerations <math alttext="lowercase a sub uppercase A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="lowercase a sub B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the two blocks?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of two lines in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with the horizontal axis labeled t. One line, labeled lowercase a sub uppercase A, begins at the origin and moves steeply upward and to the right at a constant rate. The other line, labeled lowercase a sub B begins at the origin and moves gradually upward and to the right at a constant rate.

The figure presents a graph of two lines in the first quadrant of the coordinate plan with the horizontal axis labeled t. One line, labeled lowercase a sub B, begins at the origin and moves steeply upward and to the right at a constant rate. The other line, labeled lowercase a sub uppercase A, begins at the origin and moves gradually upward and to the right at a constant rate.

The figure presents a graph of two parallel lines in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled t. One line, labeled lowercase a sub uppercase A, begins above the origin on the vertical axis and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate. The other line, labeled lowercase a sub B, begins to the right of the origin on the horizontal axis and moves upward and to the right at a constant rate, in parallel with the line labeled lowercase a sub uppercase A.

The figure presents a graph of two parallel lines in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled t. One line, labeled lowercase a sub uppercase A, begins approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right. The other line, labeled lowercase a sub B, begins approximately one quarter of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right, in parallel with the line labeled lowercase a sub uppercase A.

The figure presents a graph of two parallel lines in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled t. One line, labeled lowercase a sub B, begins approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right. The other line, labeled lowercase a sub uppercase A, begins approximately one quarter of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right, in parallel with the line labeled lowercase a sub B.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of two parallel lines in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with horizontal axis labeled t. One line, labeled lowercase a sub B, begins approximately three quarters of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right. The other line, labeled lowercase a sub uppercase A, begins approximately one quarter of the way up the vertical axis above the origin and moves horizontally to the right, in parallel with the line labeled lowercase a sub B.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
